title: Ticket #6156: Suppress DAGMan message about shared port
description:
Several LIGO users have noted that DAGMan startup contains a scary-looking message about shared port being unavailable, for example: 

   02/15/17 07:45:14 SharedPortEndpoint: failed to open ./shared_port_ad: No such file or directory
   02/15/17 07:45:14 SharedPortEndpoint: did not successfully find SharedPortServer address. Will retry in 60s.

This seems harmless. It's due to the new USE_SHARED_PORT default and DAGMan not being able to use shared port.

Should be a one-line change to disable this setting for tools and condor_dagman; can it make it in time for 8.6.1?
remarks:
2017-Feb-20 16:17:52 by tannenba:
At first blush, I think it would be fine to add to the param table 

   DAGMAN.USE_SHARED_PORT=False

but I am not so sure we can simply set USE_SHARED_PORT=False for Tools. Imagine running a tool like ssh_to_job or condor_fetchlog that needs to contact an execute machine behind a firewall via CCB; in this case, the reversed CCB connection may need to arrive via shared_port and the tool will need to know this.

2017-Feb-20 16:23:55 by tannenba:
Random thought -- does DAGMan need a command port at all on LINUX platforms? If each running DAGMan uses a command port, that is unfortunate since there are only so many ports available. Of course, on Windows, I think a command port is required since that is how DAGMan receives signals from the schedd....

2017-Feb-20 16:47:43 by tlmiller:
DAGMan is started with -p 0, which the code says and Jaime empirically confirmed prevents the creation of a command socket. However -- presumably to enable shared pot with CCB -- daemon core unconditionally initializes shared port in reconfig(), which is typically called during start-up.

Our brief testing and looking at the error message make us wonder if there's (also) a problem with DAGMan changing the LOG directory or something (why is the shared port endpoint looking in '.' for the shared_port_ad?), but it's probably the case -- we'd have to check the initializer code -- that just turning off shared port for dagman would work fine.

We should ask Kent if we want to continue/finish our investigation.

2017-Feb-21 15:01:19 by jfrey:
If you pass -port 0 on the command line, DaemonCore doesn't create a TCP/UDP command port. But it does try to create a shared port command port. This is a bug.

For DAGMan, the attempt to create a shared port command port is messed up by the "-l ." command line argument, which overrides the value of the LOG parameter. Thus, it can't find the shared_port_ad file and creates a daemon_sock directory under its current working directory.

If I create symlinks for shared_port_ad and daemon_sock in the current working directory to point to the real locations, then I can send commands to DAGMan by using an appropriate sinful string.

We can set DAGMAN_USE_SHARED_PORT=False in the param table to avoid these problems. I propose a more thorough fix whereby DaemonCore doesn't create a shared port endpoint if -port 0 is passed on the command line (i.e. don't create a command port).

2017-Feb-21 16:04:17 by wenger:
Another alternative would be to have condor_submit_dag set _CONDOR_DAGMAN_USE_SHARED_PORT=0 in the environment in the .condor.sub file.

Either way, I guess I figure we should put in a simple fix for 8.6.1 to make sure this is fixed ASAP.

2017-Feb-21 16:16:33 by wenger:
Okay, just talked to Jaime about this, and I'm going to add DAGMAN_USE_SHARED_PORT = false to the param table, and do a build/test to make sure that doesn't goof anything up.

2017-Feb-23 09:55:18 by wenger:
Here's the diff: 

  manta(663)% git diff
  diff --git a/src/condor_utils/param_info.in b/src/condor_utils/param_info.in
  index 5a88b91..5b93435 100644
  --- a/src/condor_utils/param_info.in
  +++ b/src/condor_utils/param_info.in
  @@ -741,6 +741,14 @@ customization=expert
   tags=dagman,dagman_main
   restart=never


  +# Fixes gittrac #6156.
  +[DAGMAN_USE_SHARED_PORT]
  +default=false
  +type=bool
  +customization=never
  +tags=dagman,dagman_main
  +restart=never
  +
   [CKPT_SERVER_DIR]
   default=
   type=string
  manta(664)%

I'm going to assign this to Jaime for review...

2017-Feb-27 14:26:58 by tlmiller:
Code Review

This looks good.
